cards.name: Aesthir Glider
cards.text:
Flying

Aesthir Glider can't block.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Aesthir Glider cannot block.
cards.flavor:
"A fine example of the rewards of artifice: a thoroughly obedient steed with wings of Soldevi steel."

—Arcum Dagsson,

Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

cards.name: Benalish Knight
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.originalText:
First strike

You may play Benalish Knight any time you could play an instant.
cards.flavor:
"We called them ‘armored lightning.'"

—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from white
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

cards.name: Brushland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Canopy Spider can block creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."

—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender
cards.flavor:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."

—Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Combat Medic
cards.text: {1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Prevent 1 damage to a creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."

—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

cards.name: Cuombajj Witches
cards.text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.
cards.originalText: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player of your choice and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice. (Choose your target first.)

rulings.text: In multiplayer games you can choose a different opposing player each time it is used. You also don't have to choose the same player that you targeted with the effect (or whose creature you targeted).
If either target becomes invalid, the other one is still affected.
Both targets are chosen on activation, but you choose your target before the opponent chooses.
The two targets can be the same.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment or artifact.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Drifting Meadow
cards.text:
Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Drifting Meadow comes into play tapped.

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep.
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next turn. (If defending player controls a forest, that creature is unblockable.)

rulings.text: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

cards.name: Feast of the Unicorn
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+0.
cards.flavor:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."

—Autumn Willow

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.

Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
cards.originalText:
At the time you play Fireball, pay an additional {1} for each target beyond the first.

Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.

If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: G
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Freewind Falcon
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"That does it I'm going back to hunting chickens"

—Rhirhok, goblin archer

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Giant Spider can block creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks"

"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade's ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse"

"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

cards.name: Goblin Grenade
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin.

Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
At the time you play Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin.

Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"I don't suppose we could teach them to throw the cursed things?"

—Ivra Jursdotter

rulings.text: You can't sacrifice more than one Goblin to get a greater effect.
Players can only respond once Goblin Grenade has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try and destroy the Goblin to prevent you from casting Goblin Grenade.
The Goblin you sacrifice to cast Goblin Grenade doesn't have to be a creature. For example, you could sacrifice Boggart Shenanigans (a tribal enchantment with the subtype Goblin).

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back"

—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText: All goblins get +1/+1 and gain mountainwalk. (If defending player controls a mountain, those creatures are unblockable.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . ."

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card. If you do, reveal that card, put it into your hand, and shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Mutant
cards.text:
Trample

Goblin Mutant can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.

Goblin Mutant can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.originalText:
Trample

Goblin Mutant cannot attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or more.

Goblin Mutant cannot block a creature with power 3 or more.

cards.name: Goblin Offensive
cards.text: Put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Put X Goblin tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures.
cards.flavor: They certainly are.

rulings.text: The tokens are named "Goblin" and are of creature type "Goblin".
X can be zero.

cards.name: Goblin Recruiter
cards.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Recruiter comes into play, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal them to all players. Shuffle your library, then put the revealed cards on top of it in any order.
cards.flavor: "Next"

rulings.text: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Snowman
cards.text:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.originalText:
When Goblin Snowman blocks, it does not deal or receive combat damage that turn.

{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it is blocking.
cards.flavor:
"Strength in numbers? Right."

—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

cards.name: Goblin Tinkerer
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals damage equal to its converted mana cost to Goblin Tinkerer.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals damage equal to its total casting cost to Goblin Tinkerer.
cards.flavor:
"Can they do that?"

—Imwita, Zhalfirin artificer, last words

cards.name: Goblin Vandal
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Vandal attacks and isn't blocked, you may pay {R}. If you do, destroy target artifact defending player controls and Goblin Vandal assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.originalText: {R} Destroy target artifact defending player controls. Goblin Vandal deals no combat damage this turn. Use this ability only if Goblin Vandal is attacking and unblocked and only once each turn.

rulings.text: If the defending player controls no artifacts that you can target, the ability doesn't go on the stack and you can't pay {R}.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three Goblin tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures.
cards.flavor: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."    Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

rulings.text: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

cards.name: Gorilla Chieftain
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Regenerate
cards.flavor:
"Oh, no—not you again?"

—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"The raging winds . . . , settling on the sea, the surges sweep, / Raise liquid mountains, and disclose the deep."

—Virgil, Aeneid, Book I, trans. Dryden

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Hymn to Tourach
cards.text: Target player discards two cards at random.
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards at random from his or her hand. (If that player has only one card, he or she discards it.)

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Whenever Hypnotic Specter successfully deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random from his or her hand.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.name: Icatian Javelineers
cards.text:
Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it.

{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
When Icatian Javelineers comes into play, put a javelin counter on it.

{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

foreignNames.name: アイケイシアの投槍兵

cards.name: Ihsan's Shade
cards.text: Protection from white
cards.originalText: Protection from white
cards.flavor:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra Paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."

—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."

—Telim'Tor

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then choose and discard a card.
cards.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.

cards.name: Knight of Stromgald
cards.text:
Protection from white

{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.

{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Protection from white

{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.

{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lady Orca
cards.flavor: "I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone."A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.

—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

cards.name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
cards.text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.originalText:
Mirri, Cat Warrior counts as a Cat Warrior.

First strike; forestwalk (If defending player controls any forests, this creature is unblockable.)

Attacking does not cause Mirri to tap.

cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: "I got it I got it I—"
printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Mogg Flunkies
cards.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
cards.originalText: Mogg Flunkies cannot attack or block unless another creature you control attacks or blocks the same turn.
cards.flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

rulings.text: Mogg Flunkies can be declared as an attacker only if another creature is declared as an attacker at the same time. Similarly, Mogg Flunkies can be declared as a blocker only if another creature is declared as a blocker at the same time.
Two or more Mogg Flunkies can attack or block together.

Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, the other attacking creature(s) doesn't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls.

In a Two-Headed Giant game (or in another format using the shared team turns option), Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Mogg Raider
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.text: R
cards.originalText: R
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.

{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
cards.originalText:
Nevinyrral's Disk comes into play tapped.

{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

rulings.text: Creatures can be regenerated although the Auras on the creatures will still be destroyed by the Disk.

The destruction of the Disk is not a sacrifice. It is destroyed as part of the resolution if it is still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral's Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it won't be destroyed by its ability.

cards.name: Order of the White Shield
cards.text:
Protection from black

{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.

{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Protection from black

{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.

{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A shield of light admits no shadow.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."

—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature cannot attack or block.
cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

cards.name: Pegasus Charger
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor:
"The clouds came alive and dove to the earth Hooves flashed among the dark army, who fled before the spectacle of fury."

—Song of All, canto 211

cards.name: Pegasus Stampede
cards.text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)

Put a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put Pegasus Stampede into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)

Put a Pegasus token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 white creature with flying.

cards.name: Pendelhaven
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool

{T}: Target 1/1 creature gains +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old."Henry Wadsworth

Longfellow, "Evangeline"

rulings.text: The current power/toughness being 1/1 is a targeting requirement so it is checked when announcing and again right before resolving.

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W
cards.originalText: W
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Polluted Mire
cards.text:
Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Polluted Mire comes into play tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Pyrokinesis
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.

Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
cards.originalText:
You may remove a red card in your hand from the game instead of paying Pyrokinesis's casting cost.

Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: You can't do fractional points of damage.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."

—Navajo war chant

rulings.text: You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
You can't do fractional points of damage.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.originalText: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness.
cards.flavor: Charging alone takes uncommong daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.

cards.name: Ranger en-Vec
cards.text:
First strike

{G}: Regenerate Ranger en-Vec.
cards.originalText:
First strike

{G}: Regenerate Ranger en-Vec.
cards.flavor:
"The path of least resistance will seldom lead you beyond your doorstep."

—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent 1 damage to a creature or player.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying

Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

Attacking does not cause Serra Angel to tap.
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

cards.name: Serrated Arrows
cards.text:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.

At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.

{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Serrated Arrows comes into play with three arrowhead counters on it.

When there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, destroy it.

{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you've somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

cards.name: Slippery Karst
cards.text:
Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Slippery Karst comes into play tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Smoldering Crater comes into play tapped.

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Spectral Bears
cards.text: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
cards.originalText: When Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black cards, Spectral Bears does not untap during your next untap phase.
cards.flavor: "I hear there are Bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."Gulsen, Abbey Matron

rulings.text: The checks for black cards is made both at the time you declare attackers and as the ability resolves. If there are any at the time attackers are declared, it won't trigger at all. If there are any at the time it resolves, the ability will do nothing.

cards.name: Strip Mine
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colors mana to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.text: B
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
cards.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. That creature's controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: If the creature has a negative power, the player does not lose life. It acts the same as if it had a power of zero.
The amount of life that's gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Uthden Troll
cards.text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
cards.originalText: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
cards.flavor:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,

Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,

Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh

'n da hurt'll disappear."

—Troll chant

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying

Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

Volcanic Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.
cards.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."

—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

rulings.text: Warrior's Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won't get the bonus.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from black
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

cards.name: Woolly Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Wooly Spider can block creatures with flying.

When Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."

—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter
